content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #77869 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
So this looks like that the issue earlier today that the reporter couldn't replicate right?
yeah, I commented on the issue
Ah, sound
I'd love to see a smaller repro here but perhaps not easy to do, being an out-of-memory error? Would it make sense trying getting an mcve?
Also, @Camelid the linked issues #77849 happened on macOS, what specifically suggests this issue to be O-linux?
if we can still duplicate this issue, I wonder if this doesn't deserve P-critical until we find more info
or well, we could wait given that the next release is still a bit far away
yeah I agree with waiting a little bit more and see if we can have something more actionable. Either from issue or the other one

apiraino said:

Also, Camelid the linked issues #77849 happened on macOS, what specifically suggests this issue to be O-linux?

@apiraino I guess I was a little over-eager because I thought it could be OS-specific, and I saw linux in the target triple :embarrassed:

Removed the label
ah right no worries, I'm still figuring out these labels :)
Yeah, me too :)
this one needs prioritization
unsure if we have new information for us to decide on a priority ...
looking at it
left a comment, let's see if we have enough data to build a case
How about nominating this issue to have a comment from the compiler team with the data available?
this is the only I-prioritize issue we have without priority
I'm not sure if we want to wait for more information on the issue or want to try to add a priority to it for now

personally I wouldn't know which priority would I assign (a P-high?) I've suggested I-nominate because the issue commenters did a great job trying to understand what's going on, so I don't know if we can squeeze additional info out of it.
I'd bring it on the table's meeting and say "hey, this is what we know, what do you think? where do we go from here?"
I am not convinced this is a stable-to-stable regression, just that the author first noticed it in an upgrade
I suggest P-medium I-nominate

Joshua Nelson said:

I suggest P-medium I-nominate

:+1: can you do so? :)
Issue #77869's prioritization request has been removed.
I'm adding a bit of feedback on the prioritization of this issue (as a reminder for my future self). Today's discussion was more oriented towards a P-high
